TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ResolveCompletedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs

Docs.summary: Used in conjunction with the event, which is signaled when a resolve request for a specific has completed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To use the ResolveCompletedEventArgs object, instantiate a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameResolver> object and utilize one of the Resolve methods. For asynchronous processing, use the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameResolver.ResolveAsync%2A> method.
When the Resolver has reached the end of the Cloud(s) to query for the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName>, or it has reached the maximum number of record entries for the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecordCollection> it is constructing, the event to complete the resolve process is raised, and the associated delegate causes ResolveAsync to complete. The event can also be raised for abnormal completions, which do not return a collection.
This event is raised only once when all endpoints have been found.
All references to this instance of the Resolver object are coordinated with a supplied token, which is a unique, developer-determined identifier for this asynchronous resolve request.

MemberSignature.Value: public ResolveCompletedEventArgs (System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecordCollection peerNameRecordCollection, Exception error, bool canceled, object userToken);

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PeerNameRecordCollection As PeerNameRecordCollection

Docs.value: The object to resolve is the one found in response to a operation on a specific .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is raised when all clouds have been queried for this peer name, or when the maximum number of peer name records has been retrieved. It is raised by putting the peer name record collection into the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.ResolveCompletedEventArgs> event argument for which the OnResolveCompleted method is waiting. The change in state awakens the process.
Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is `null` for reference types and zero (0) for properties of type `int`. If no records were found, `null` is returned.
